description: From earlier tattaow, tattow, a borrowing from a Polynesian language, e.g. Samoan tatau (“tattoo; to tap, to strike”).

entries.meaning: An image made in the skin with ink and a needle.
A method of decorating the skin by inserting colored substances under the surface with a sharp instrument (usually a solenoid-driven needle).

verbs.description: tattoo (third-person singular simple present tattoos, present participle tattooing, simple past and past participle tattooed)

entries.meaning: To apply a tattoo to (someone or something).
(baseball) To hit the ball hard, as if to figuratively leave a tattoo on the ball.
examples: Jones tattoos one into the gap in left; that will clear the bases.

description: From earlier tap-to, borrowed from Dutch taptoe, from tap (“tap; faucet on a cask”) + toe (“to; shut”). More at tap, to.

entries.meaning: (nautical) A signal played five minutes before taps (lights out).
examples: Study goes on until tattoo, which, when Pops was at the Point, was sounded at 9.30, followed by taps at 10.

entries.meaning: (military) A signal by drum or bugle ordering soldiers to return to their quarters.

verbs.description: tattoo (third-person singular simple present tattoos, present participle tattooing, simple past and past participle tattooed)

entries.meaning: To tap rhythmically on, to drum.
A pony of a certain breed from India.
